title: Leicester supporter claims she was choked by Spanish police during recent trip to Seville
text:
Sport Leicester supporter claims she was choked by Spanish police during recent trip to Seville The Foxes were in Champions League action in southern Spain three weeks ago and one fan has bad memories of the match Share A Leicester fan claims she was attacked by police during a recent match away to Sevilla (Photo: Getty) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
A Leicester City fan has claimed she was attacked by Spanish police during the Foxes' recent Champions League game in Seville. 
Abi Morris, 24, says she has struggled to sleep since an officer allegedly grabbed her around the throat with a baton as she tried to help another person who had been knocked over. 
Abi, who suffers with a heart condition, claims she was minding her own business and having a quiet drink with her family and other Leicester fans when things began to get nasty in the southern Spanish city on February 22. 
She told the Hinckley Times: “We were just a small group minding our own business when four police vans pulled up. 
“Out jumped a group of officers and without any warning they just starting pushing into the Leicester fans. Abi Morris was in Spain for the Foxes' game against Sevilla (Photo: Getty) 
“It was pure brute force. There was an older fan with his daughter and they just pushed into him. 
“He fell over and landed hitting his head on the pavement with such force. How he didn’t crack his head open I do not know. 
“My instinct was to help him but when I did one of the police officers grabbed me with a baton round the throat and dragged me into the middle of the street.” 
The sales worker, who had been watching the match in the pub with her mum while her brother and father went to the game, said: “It was horrible.” Abi watched Leicester's 2-1 defeat in a pub with her mum (Photo: Michael Regan) 
She said she believed they came looking for a fight. 
“There was no way I was going to give them a fight,” Abi said. “I weigh less than eight stones but that didn’t stop them.” 
The incident was caught on camera by another Leicester fan Ryan Flowers. 
His footage shows Abi screaming as she is manhandled by the officer. The incident was reportedly caught on camera by another fan (Photo: AFP) 
The incident prompted Abi to have heart palpitations but she says the police refused her family's request for a medic. 
She said: “I was feeling really unwell. My mum went up to the senior officer to ask for help. 
“I was worried I was going to get worse.” 
Help eventually arrived from the Spanish owner of a nearby hostel who came out to assist Abi, as the fans and the police left the scene. A hostel worker eventually assisted Abi, who suffers with a heart condition (Photo: REUTERS) 
She said: “He was great and luckily I have learned to control my condition when I have a panic attack. 
“After 20 minutes I was feeling better but I was left covered in bruises and it really spoiled what was otherwise a wonderful break in a wonderful city. 
“I've had nightmares since then and struggled to sleep.” 
Dad Rob Morris, from Frolesworth near Lutterworth, said: “What the police did was so out of proportion. There might have been some bits of trouble with fans but not where we were.” Abi's dad described the behaviour of police as "out of proportion" (Photo: REUTERS) 
He said: “They were just animals and if they are allowed to carry on like that one day they will kill someone. 
“They were violent towards a young woman with a heart condition who was no threat to them whatsoever.” 
Mr Morris has written to his MP Alberto Costa to raise the matter. 
The South Leicestershire MP has responded to say he will take the matter up with the Foreign Office. Like us on Facebook
